reviews.text: If you are looking for nightlife, variety of restaurants and bar, all at an arms length; this is the place for you. Seems to be a very ordinary building from outside, rooms inside are cozy and comfortble. There is no lift, so be careful while lifting big luggage over the stairs. Staff is very fiendly (by being not concerned very much, just to guide what you need). Can get in any time in your room as separate keys are provided for quiet entry without distubing others. Rooms are near busy road but very comfortable with separate bathrooms which are clean. They deposit 30 Euro for keys, which are refunded during check out. Good Indian restaurant by the side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wow, what a location

reviews.text: We have just gor back from a great weekend away as a group of friends and this hotel helped to make it special. I have stayed in a number of different types of hotel In amsterdam and the little boutique touches of the roomssets it aside. If you want to exepreince trur amsterdam in the heart of the city and a really cool group of staff then book into the greenhouse effect.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great location & staff - The best Amsterdam experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The value is also very good considering it's location, rooms and continental breakfast. Paul the geordie Bar Manager is also spot on with the customers and looked after us all well! cheers, Chris ( Daffyd )
reviews.title: RAD TIME WITH THE CREW

reviews.text: STAYED HERE FOR MY BIRTHDAY the staff couldnt do enough for us the bar and hotel are a great place to hang and chill i will always stay with green house great people
reviews.title: Better than the big chain hotels, A Fantastic place to stay.

reviews.text: enough respect from NASH AND DEATH !!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I went to check in I was told I had booked for the wrong day and sorry they were full! After showing my confirmation and proving the mistake was theirs and not mine the manager had to come and sort out my reservation.
reviews.title: What a Hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a themed apartment as I presumed this was an upgrade on a standard room, wrong!! What I got was a tatty student bedsit located in a building with severe subsidence about a mile away from the actual hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Greenhouse Effect

reviews.text: Up two very narrow and very steep flights of stairs was our room, named China Town. It had recently been painted however I have no idea why 9 different colours of paint had been used, it was vile. The walls were, White, Dark Grey, purple, mauve & black. There was a kitchen cupboard painted in red gloss with a blue splash back. The china theme was a couple of oriental pictures and a budda statue
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the subsidence (which is being monitored constantly by fixed laser measuring devices attached to the corners of the buildings in the streets) the floors slanted into one corner and it was a task to sit up straight at the table, which was also and an alarming angle.
reviews.title: A load of GAS!

reviews.text: The safe was broken, or part of it was missing, the room had wooden sash windows however they couldn’t be opened properly as the internal cables had broken and one of the panes of glass was held together with sellotape!
reviews.title: A lil' bit of heaven in the red light

reviews.text: Very friendly and easy check in, small deposite left for keys but was no problem really. We were staying in the Lounge appartment and the Uptown appartment, both where right across the street from the Greenhouse effect bar and cafe. The Lounge slept 4 quite cumfortably and was very clean and spaciouse with a great view of the street bellow. The Uptown was just some thing else, we thought it was a mistake when we opened the door, the place was huge, with a view over one of the main cannals in amsterdam, it would easily sleep 6 and was also very clean. I would reccomend both these appartments to small groups of friends looking for some nice private accomadation instead of a hostel.
reviews.title: Great Appartments, Great Location

reviews.text: I booked a room by email (stay@greenhouse-effect.nl) after finding all the needed information (including all prices) on their website (http://www.greenhouse-effect.nl) between November 12 and 16, 2010.
reviews.title: Perfect central location! I really suggest this Hotel!

reviews.text: The room i had selected was room #4 'Fluo'... the subject is very futuristic and although in the photos on the website may look a bit psycho, it's very nice and the lights inside won't make you go crazy!
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: The location is perfect! Situated in the heart of the Red Light District. It just 2min walk from Grasshopper. 10min walk from the Amsterdam Central Station (train). 2min walk from Dam Square and Damrak. Snack bars, bars and restaurant are all round!
reviews.title: Great apartment well worth the money!!

reviews.text: The service is good, considering that it's not a high class hotel. I have to say i was very impressed with the upkeep of the rooms. Cleaning staff take care for cleaning the rooms at a very good time (if you're still in the room, then they will do it later). Towels are changed every day, if you leave them on the floor.
reviews.title: had a great time apart from rude barman

reviews.text: We stayed in the actual hotel in room 'Arabian Nights', the place is quite quirky and the rooms are interesting to say the least. Unfortunately our window looked out onto a brick wall so we didnt have a great view but you dont go to Amsterdam to sit in your room and stare out the window.
reviews.title: Great place in the heart of Amsterdam!

reviews.text: The location is absolutely perfect, only 5 mins walk from Centraal station and right in the middle of all the action. As a guest at the hotel you get discounts in both the coffee shop and the bar (only E2.50 a pint - ACE) which is great as its very expensive to drink in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: i just keep coming back to this place!

reviews.text: The great thing about the bar is that it keeps the back area blocked off for hotel residents so it doesnt matter how busy it is there is always somewhere to sit if you're a guest at the hotel. Its also great if there are people in your party who are not there to smoke as there are not very many bars where you can drink alcohol and have a smoke and you can do both in their bar!
reviews.title: Love it, fab place for smoke and pint

reviews.text: Breakfast is good, I have been to Amsterdam 10 times and stayed at numerous different hotels so I speak from experience when I say that the breakfast is pretty much exactly the same no matter where you go, its also on till noon which is perfect after a late night!
reviews.title: Very Centrally Located, 'interesting place"

reviews.text: The only thing that I would say let this place down is that because you are allowed to smoke in the rooms they are a bit dingy and smell a bit stale and no one comes to tidy the room / change the towels but we were there for 4 nights so didnt really both us that much.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Greenhouse Effect apartments!
